titleStmt.title: A supplication of the Family of Loue (said to be presented into the Kings royall hands, knowen to be dispersed among his loyall subiectes) for grace and fauour Examined, and found to be derogatorie in an hie degree, vnto the glorie of God, the honour of our King, and the religion in this realme both soundly professed & firmly established.

A supplication of the Family of Loue (said to be presented into the Kings royall hands, knowen to be dispersed among his loyall subiectes) for grace and fauour Examined, and found to be derogatorie in an hie degree, vnto the glorie of God, the honour of our King, and the religion in this realme both soundly professed & firmly established.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed[ by H. Lownes] for Iohn Legate, Printer to the Vniuersitie of Cambridge,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The families supplication examined and confuted.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
